data.title: Sporting Kansas City
data.meta_description: Official roster for Sporting Kansas City - including player stats, roster status and category.
data.text:
Click here to view all of Bieler's 2013 MLS regular season goals and assists

The team’s fourth Designated Player in club history, Bieler was acquired in 2013 from LDU Quito, where he won Copa Sudamericana and Copa Libertadores. A dual citizen of Ecuador and Argentina, Bieler has played professionally in both countries and also in Chile. Nicknamed “El Taca,” Bieler became the second DP in MLS history to score goals in his first two MLS matches.

2014: MLS regular season: Scored two goals in 13 appearances, four of them starts. Scored his first goal of the season as a second half substitute in a 2-0 win over Columbus on May 4. Scored in a 4-0 win at Chivas USA on Sept. 12. MLS Playoffs: Did not feature. CCL: Started both legs of the 2013-14 CONCACAF Champions League quarterfinals vs. Cruz Azul. Assisted Kevin Ellis' first career goal in the 1-0 first leg win on March 12. Started two of three total appearances (165 minutes) in the 2014-15 group stage. Scored two goals in a 3-0 win over Real Esteli on Sept. 23. Open Cup: Started and played 62 minutes in a 2-0 fourth round win over Minnesota United FC on June 18. Friendly: Played 45 minutes in a 4-1 Champions Shield defeat to Manchester City on July 23 at Sporting Park.

2013: Sporting KC's 2013 Golden Boot Winner. MLS: Appeared in 28 regular season games with 25 starts. Earned Sporting KC Golden Boot with 10 goals scored, becoming first Designated Player in club history to record double-digit goals. Scored March 2 against Philadelphia and March 9 against Toronto FC to become first Designated Player in club history to score in his first two games. Scored consecutive game-winning goals against Montreal Impact (March 30) and D.C. United (April 5). Bieler secured his first assist on May 26 vs Houston Dynamo. He added another goal to the stat sheet against Montreal Impact via a penalty kick (49+) on June 1. Tallied a goal and an assist in games against the Columbus Crew on June 29 and September 7. Scored goal in 3-0 win over Toronto FC (July 20) following a 12-pass sequence in which nine different players touched the ball. Playoffs: Appeared in four matches during the 2013 MLS Cup Playoffs. Scored the game-winning goal in the second leg of the Eastern Conference Semifinal series vs. New England. Converted his penalty kick attempt in the MLS Cup Final penalty shootout. CCL: Started two 2013-14 CONCACAF Champions League group stage matches; at CD Olimpia (August 27) and vs. Real Esteli (September 17). Open Cup: Played in Lamar Hunt U.S. Open Cup matches against the Des Moines Menace (May 28) and Orlando City Lions (June 14).

PROFESSIONAL:
